Summary The eldest son of an immigrant small business owner and a schoolteacher, Petros was born and raised in Tacoma, Washington. A University of Washington graduate, where he was a member of Beta Theta Pi Fraternity, Petros later earned an MBA from Arizona State University. 
 
After a career at the world’s largest semiconductor manufacturer, Petros joined the consulting firm his father started, under challenging circumstances. Thrust into the CEO position after his father’s tragic passing from bladder cancer, Petros was called upon to lead the organization at a young age. After recovering from the passing of its founder, the firm has grown significantly, expanded into new geographic markets, and delivered new service offerings to clients. In 2011, bit by the entrepreneurial bug like his parents before him, Petros co-founded a financial-technology services company, which empowers individuals to plan and save for a dignified retirement. 
 
In 2013, the Puget Sound Business Journal honored Petros as one of the region's 40 Under 40 -- an award recognizing the top business leaders under the age of 40 who excel in their industry and show dynamic leadership. 
 
Passionate about giving back to the community, the Koumantaros family launched the Pano Koumantaros Cancer Research Fund, named after Petros’s father, which has raised more than $1.4 Million in support of cancer research, care, and treatment initiatives.
